properties.name: Classically Facedown trained?! (185/365)
properties.description: Open photo page What a day i spent hours wondering around to take my facedown shot had so many ideas. Got kicked out of a fair few places even before i could get my shot. So i ended up at a local hairdressers with a Grand piano in and this came to light! Only in Brighton heh! I was almost thrown out of here as well as i was not allowed to touch the piano. She is just coming to throw me out ah well! properties.name: 186/365: Train [EXPLORE 5.7.11 No 136]
properties.description: Open photo page HFDT! Only had time for one shot today and I apologise for the out of focus nature of this one. Just in case anyone is worried, I'd like to confirm two things: first, although this was the quiet carriage, I promise that I did not make any noise and, second, I took my shoes off before doing this. You can actually see one of them on the floor to the left of the picture. So, nothing to concern any of my fellow travellers. No, nothing at all. I think it is fair to say that this is the least deserving of my handful of Explores!Taken on 5th July, 2011 by Zenas Mtrain,  bristol,  july,  seats ... Anyone can see this location

properties.name: Day Hundred and Eighty-Six
properties.description: Open photo page 186 / 365 : <b> FDT: Home Sweet Homeâ„¢ Style </b> Happy Facedown Tuesday!!!! Damn, i usually get to Tuesday and i either have and idea for the photo, or i find one straight away. In the remote possibility none of what's above happens, i can still manage to spend a ridiculous amount of time looking for the one location i really like. Not today :( Had a pretty full day and found myself desperately looking for locations and ideas for the Facedown photo but it seemed impossible to find something that could please me. At last, almost in the verge of surrendering, i walked home and, once i got there, i knew it: today's shot HAD to be taken in front of home. And so i did. And actually, i like how it turned out :) I guess it's true when they say: nothing feels like home, huh?! HFDT! <a href="http://nicolabernardi.tumblr.com" rel="nofollow">Tumbrl</a> <a href="http://twitter.com/ncbernardi" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a> <b>Camera Info:</b> Nikon D300 | 35mm (Æ’/1.8G) @ 35mm | Æ’/2 | ISO 800 | 1/10 s â€” Camera on TripodTaken on 5th July, 2011 by Nicola Bernardihome,  face,  stairs,  35mm ... Anyone can see this location

properties.name: Hipster FDT
properties.description: Open photo page Well, it's true. :) We FDT'ers were cutting edge (ironically, symbollically and sarcastically) and we knew of "planking" before there was such a term. Day 37 of 100 days of summer It felt pretty good to lay facedown after jumping for the 4 previous Tuesdays. :) This facedown was inspired by an old <a href="http://www.flickr.com/groups/therogueplayers/discuss/72157626065022143/">hipster theme</a> in TRP. I didn't play then, so this is my makeup shot. :) I wanted to go facedown in front of Urban Outfitters, so I checked the phone book to see if there was one in Greenville. Nope, I didn't see it, but I did see this spa/salon, which ironically worked. (totally) texture (Tuesday) from <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/13796443@N05/5750947027/">osolev</a> HFDT!Taken on 4th July, 2011 by pikespicegeotagged,  hipster,  gimp,  geotag ... Anyone can see this location

properties.name: The Brilliance Of Old People
properties.description: Open photo page Turning 45 last week has made me re think the word old. We go around thinking the elderly are senile, cranky or stupid but they are not. They are in fact, brilliant. Here are just a few reasons. 1. I don't remember. This is how you get out of trouble for not doing something. We just assume there memory is failing when in fact it is sharp as knife. 2. I am not strong enough anymore. This is how they get us to carry things or move them. The fact is, most could probably beat the crud out of us. 3. Could you run some errands for me? I am sure my grandma drove down the sidewalk on purpose making sure she wouldn't have do the shopping anymore. 4. I'm sorry, I can't hear a thing. They heard you. They are just ignoring you. 5. Cranky. Lets be real, you'll agree with everything to get them back to happy. 6. The power nap. We call it falling down. I'm already at that one. View on black. I'm sorry, I didn't hear you. Our Daily Challenge: Low ------------------------ Inqspired by Tony and his brilliantly funny face down shots. Check them out <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/37239103@N06/sets/72157625673163157/">www.flickr.com/photos/37239103@N06/sets/72157625673163157/</a>Taken on 1st July, 2011 by hbmike2000portrait,  self,  glasses,  nikon ... Anyone can see this location

properties.name: Day Hundred and Seventy-Nine
properties.description: Open photo page 179 / 365 : <b> FDT: Wild Wild Meadowsâ„¢ Style </b> Happy Face Down Tuesday!!!! Today i was seriously excited about having finally the whole free afternoon to find location for my FDTs. Scouted here in there around town and then decided to go in Maruyama Park (which is more like a forest actually), next to Sapporo's Zoo to see what could come out there. As always, forgot some little details: like for example that if you go in June, in a forest, where there's a creek passing by... you'll have to face THEM. Yes, bugs. EVERYWHERE. E-V-E-R-Y-W-H-E-R-E. They probably sensed me from far away because literally, as soon as i stepped into the park i got greed by swarms and swarms of hungry bugs. Such a pain to check for exposition, position, geometry of the shot when all you can hear is "bzzzzz" and all you can see is little tiny winged blood-sucking demons on your fisheye lens. (yes, in some shots they were even on my lens.) Unbelievable. And they were big! The European ones in comparison are like sand grains to pebbles. But hey, when we hold the Face Down Tuesday's sword, we're ready to face anything in order to achieve THE shot. Amen! Ps: One of my FDT photos got chosen for Flickr's Official Blog about planking. Hurray! <a href="http://blog.flickr.net/fr/2011/06/24/cest-toi-la-planche" rel="nofollow">Check it Out!</a> HFDT! <a href="http://nicolabernardi.tumblr.com" rel="nofollow">Tumbrl</a> <a href="http://twitter.com/ncbernardi" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a> <b>Camera Info:</b> Nikon D300 | Samyang 8mm (Æ’/3.5) @ 8mm | Æ’/8 | ISO 400 | 1/2 s â€” Camera on TripodTaken on 28th June, 2011 by Nicola Bernardipark,  wood,  bridge,  face ... Anyone can see this location

properties.name: 172/365   Facedown Tuesday XIII: Levitation VII
properties.description: Open photo page 172/365 HFDT everybody!! I never thought I would enjoy Tuesdays so much in my life. I woke up late and had to do my FDT at work today. This is the store room at Marble Slab. I convinced one of my co-workers to get in on the FDT goodness with me. I've been doing some levitation shots and thought I should combine the two. Levitation and Facedown Tuesday!! She's floating above me. I think I'm a wizard...... Also be sure to check out <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/astrophotos/sets/72157626534596720/with/5858968338/">Facedown Tuesdays I-XII</a> and <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/astrophotos/sets/72157626894326627/with/5858968338/">Levitations I-VI</a> as well!!
